SENT.plain: The choice of antiarrhythmic therapy for atrial fibrillation is directly dependent on the clinical presentation
This article describes the treatment of acute attacks associated with paroxysmal forms, and also of more persistent forms
First-line relapse prevention is based on antiarrhythmic drugs, but other options such as atrial catheter ablation have recently been developed
Ablation of the normal conducting atrioventricular pathway and direct atrial surgery are also discussed
